page.title: 14Farm Survey by S.Williams.
page.content: We did a survey of 7 local farms and we found that:The farms in this area are mainly dairy with some stock rearing.Three farms are mixed and include beef,sheep and crops. The farms range from 80 to 250 acres. The average being 166 acres. A large amount of land is used for grazing and silage.The other crops grown are barley,turnips,kale,fodder beet,potatoes,wheat,linseed and corn. Most of the crops grown are for the farmers animals but some like potatoes and linseed are sold commercially. Most of the down land has now been reclaimed.Five of the of the farms are family-run and two farms employ 1-2 people.Six are tenant farmers and one owns his own farm.The land is owned by Boconnoc and Braddock Estates.
